basic/scatters.name: markers.py
basic/scatters.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/scatters/markers.py example shows all the different scatter marker types available in Bokeh on a single plot.

basic/scatters.name: color_scatter.py
basic/scatters.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/scatters/color_scatter.py example shows a multicolored scatter plot of random data with hover tool.

basic/scatters.name: elements.py
basic/scatters.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/scatters/elements.py example shows a scatter plot of density vs atomic weight of atomic elements, colormapped by their melting points.

basic/scatters.name: image_url.py
basic/scatters.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/scatters/image_url.py example shows a scatter using an arbitrary image (in this case, the Bokeh logo) for the scatter marker.

basic/lines.name: lorenz.py
basic/lines.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/lines/lorenz.py example shows a plot of the Lorenz attractor using the MultiLine glyph.

basic/data.name: linear_cmap.py
basic/data.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/linear_cmap.py example shows a hexplot of a Gaussian distribution with the hex elements colormapped by a linear colormapper.

basic/data.name: linear_cmap_colorbar.py
basic/data.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/linear_cmap_colorbar.py example shows a linear colormapper used to drive a colorbar in addition to a glyph's color.

basic/data.name: color_mappers.py
basic/data.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/color_mappers.py example shows comparison of linear and log colormaps with different palette sizes.

basic/data.name: transform_markers.py
basic/data.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/transform_markers.py example shows a scatter plot of the Palmer penguins dataset, color- and marker-mapped by species. The x-axis is flipper length (mm) and the y-axis is body mass (g).

basic/data.name: transform_jitter.py
basic/data.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/transform_jitter.py example shows a column of two categorical scatter plots of random data. The top has no jitter applied, may scatter points overlap. The bottom has jitter applied to distinguish points better.

basic/axes.name: logplot.py
basic/axes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/axes/logplot.py example shows a plot of six basic mathematical functions such as y=x and y=x**2 on a log-scale using different lines styles for each.

basic/axes.name: twin_axes.py
basic/axes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/axes/twin_axes.py example shows a plot with two x-axes on different scales on the left hand side of the plot.

basic/axes.name: fixed_axis.py
basic/axes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/axes/fixed_axis.py example shows a plot with an axis positioned in the center of the plot instead of around the sides.

basic/bars.name: basic.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/basic.py example shows a simple bar chart for counts for categories of fruits.

basic/bars.name: colormapped.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/colormapped.py example shows a simple bar plot with bars for six categories of fruit on the x-axis, and bars shaded with the Bright6 palette.

basic/bars.name: intervals.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/intervals.py example shows an interval chart showing Olympic sprint time data as intervals using blue horizontal bars for times, with a bar for each year on the y-axis.

basic/bars.name: mixed.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/mixed.py example shows a bar chart of synthetic monthly sales data, grouped by quarter. A line showing each quarterly average is overlaid.

basic/bars.name: nested_colormapped.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/nested_colormapped.py example shows a grouped bar chart on a hierarchical categorical axis of years for different categories of fruit. Each group has a silver, blue, and red bar corresponding to random values for years 2015, 2016 and 2017.

basic/bars.name: pandas_groupby_colormapped.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/pandas_groupby_colormapped.py example shows a bar chart of MPG vs cylinders using the Auto MPG dataset, colormapped by the number of cylinders.

basic/bars.name: pandas_groupby_nested.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/pandas_groupby_nested.py example shows a grouped bar chart of MPG vs cylinders and manufacturer, using the Auto MPG dataset. The bars are grouped and colormapped by the number of cylinders.

basic/bars.name: stacked.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/stacked.py example shows a stacked bar chart for random data for six categories of fruit. Each row in the stack corresponds to a different year.

basic/bars.name: stacked_split.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/stacked_split.py example.

basic/bars.name: nested.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/nested.py example shows a grouped bar chart on a hierarchical categorical axis of years for different categories of fruit. Each group has three blue bars corresponding to random values for years 2015, 2016 and 2017.

basic/bars.name: colors.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/colors.py example shows a simple bar chart of six bars shaded according to the Bright6 palette.

basic/bars.name: dodged.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/dodged.py example shows a grouped bar chart using a visual dodge on the bars, rather than a hierarchical axis. Each group has a silver, blue, and red bar illustrated in the accompanying legend.

basic/areas.name: stacked_area.py
basic/areas.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/areas/stacked_area.py example shows a stacked area plot of synthetic data for ten series, colormapped using the Sunset palette, with a legend at the top.

basic/layouts.name: anscombe.py
basic/layouts.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/layouts/anscombe.py example shows a gridplot of four scatter and regression line plots illustrating Anscombe's Quartet.

basic/annotations.name: legend.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/legend.py example shows a row of fo plots that have sine waves in different scatter and line styles, illustrated in accompanying legends.

basic/annotations.name: arrow.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/arrow.py example that shows three different arrow annotation configurations.

basic/annotations.name: band.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/band.py example that shows a band annotation around a trend line in a scatter plot.

basic/annotations.name: slope.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/slope.py example that shows an orange y=mx+b trend line in a scatter plot.

basic/annotations.name: span.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/span.py example that shows green vertical spans marking the start and end dates of Daylight Savings time in Warsaw in 2013.

basic/annotations.name: whisker.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/whisker.py example that shows whisker annotations marking quantile ranges over categorical scatter plots.

basic/annotations.name: colorbar_log.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/colorbar_log.py example that shows a log-scale color bar next to a colormapped image plot.

basic/annotations.name: box_annotation.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/box_annotation.py example shows a timeseries plot of glucose data readings with red box annotations marking regions where the readings are too high or too low.

styling/plots.name: grid_bounds.py
styling/plots.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/plots/grid_bounds.py example shows how to set bounds limits on plot grids.

styling/plots.name: minor_grid_lines.py
styling/plots.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/plots/minor_grid_lines.py example shows how to add grid lines at minor tick locations.

styling/plots.name: grid_band_fill.py
styling/plots.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/plots/grid_band_fill.py example shows how to configure solid filled grid bands.

styling/plots.name: hatch_grid_band.py
styling/plots.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/plots/hatch_grid_band.py example shows a sine wave with hatched grid bands underneath.

styling/plots.name: glyph_selection.py
styling/plots.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/plots/glyph_selection.py example shows how to configure the appearance of selected and non-selected glyphs.

styling/plots.name: glyph_hover.py
styling/plots.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/plots/glyph_hover.py example shows how to configure the appearance of hovered glyphs.

styling/plots.name: legend_location_outside.py
styling/plots.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/plots/legend_location_outside.py example shows how to add a legend outside the central plot frame.

styling/plots.name: legend_title.py
styling/plots.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/plots/legend_title.py example shows how to configure a title for a legend.

styling/mathtext.name: latex_blackbody_radiation.py
styling/mathtext.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/mathtext/latex_blackbody_radiation.py example shows plot of spectral radiance curves for an ideal radiating blackbody at various temperatures with mathtext axis labels.

styling/mathtext.name: latex_normal_distribution.py
styling/mathtext.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/mathtext/latex_normal_distribution.py example shows a plot of the sampled and ideal Gaussian distribution with mathtext axis tick labels.

styling/mathtext.name: latex_schrodinger.py
styling/mathtext.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/mathtext/latex_schrodinger.py example shows solutions of Schrödinger’s equation for the motion of a particle in one dimension in a parabolic potential well for eight energy levels, with mathtext labels for each solution.

styling/mathtext.name: latex_bessel.py
styling/mathtext.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/mathtext/latex_bessel.py example shows a plot with the first four Bessel function J_0 to J_3 with mathtext labels and a mathtext title.

styling/themes.name: caliber.py
styling/themes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/themes/caliber.py example shows basic line plot with the caliber theme.

styling/themes.name: dark_minimal.py
styling/themes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/themes/dark_minimal.py example shows basic line plot with the dark_minimal theme.

styling/themes.name: light_minimal.py
styling/themes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/themes/light_minimal.py example shows basic line plot with the light_minimal theme.

styling/themes.name: night_sky.py
styling/themes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/themes/night_sky.py example shows basic line plot with the night_sky theme.

styling/themes.name: contrast.py
styling/themes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/themes/contrast.py example shows basic line plot with the contrast theme.

topics/images.name: image_rgba.py
topics/images.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/images/image_rgba.py example shows an image plot of synthetic RGBA data.

topics/images.name: image.py
topics/images.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/images/image.py example shows a plot with a colormapped two-dimensional sine surface.

topics/images.name: image_origin_anchor.py
topics/images.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/images/image_origin_anchor.py example shows a test image with dropdown widgets for seeing the effect of changes to an image glyph's origin and anchor properties.

topics/contour.name: contour_simple.py
topics/contour.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/contour/contour_simple.py example shows an iso-contour plot with ten levels between -2 and 2.

topics/contour.name: contour.py
topics/contour.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/contour/contour.py example shows an iso-contour of a 2d trigonometric function

topics/contour.name: contour_polar.py
topics/contour.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/contour/contour_polar.py example shows an iso-contour of a polar function using hatching

topics/hex.name: hex_tile.py
topics/hex.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/hex/hex_tile.py example shows a hex tile plot of binned 2d random (Gaussian) data points, colormapped by density with the Viridis palette.

topics/hex.name: hexbin.py
topics/hex.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/hex/hexbin.py example shows a hexbin plot of 2d random (Gaussian) data points, colormapped by density with the Viridis palette.

topics/categorical.name: ridgeplot.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/ridgeplot.py example shows a ridgeline plot using the Perceptions of Probability dataset with a smoothed distribution displayed for each probability category on the y-axis.

topics/categorical.name: scatter_jitter.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/scatter_jitter.py example shows a categorical scatter plot of several years of GitHub commits. The y-axis is day of the week and the x-axis is time of day, with scater points jittered to avoid overlap

topics/categorical.name: les_mis.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/les_mis.py example shows a reproduction of D3’s Les Misérables Co-occurrence chart that illustrates which characters were in scenes together with a shaded square in the matrix plot.

topics/categorical.name: slope_graph.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/slope_graph.py example shows a slope graph of the CO2 emissions of selected countries in the years 2000 and 2010.

topics/categorical.name: heatmap_unemployment.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/heatmap_unemployment.py example shows a categorical heatmap of monthly US unemployment data from 1948 to 2016. The x-axis is years and the y-axis is month of the year.

topics/categorical.name: periodic.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/periodic.py example shows a plot that renders the periodic table of elements.

topics/categorical.name: correlogram.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/correlogram.py example shows the correlations in mineral content for 214 samples of glass fragments obtained during forensic work.

topics/hierarchical.name: treemap.py
topics/hierarchical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/hierarchical/treemap.py example treemap plot breaking down sales per city by region from the sample superstore data set.

topics/hierarchical.name: crosstab.py
topics/hierarchical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/hierarchical/crosstab.py example showing an adjacent bar chart for a crosstab of the sample superstore data set.

topics/geo.name: texas_hover_map.py
topics/geo.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/geo/texas_hover_map.py example shows a color-mapped map plot based on Texas unemployment rate per county, colormapped using the Viridis palette.

topics/geo.name: eclipse.py
topics/geo.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/geo/eclipse.py example shows a plot of US states overlaid with a trajectory marking the path of the August 2017 solar eclipse.

topics/geo.name: tile_source.py
topics/geo.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/geo/tile_source.py example shows basic map plot using a tile source provider.

topics/geo.name: tile_xyzservices.py
topics/geo.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/geo/tile_xyzservices.py example shows a map plot using Bokeh's integration with xyzservices for tile providers.

topics/geo.name: tile_demo.py
topics/geo.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/geo/tile_demo_map.py example shows a grid of map plots at identical locations using various different tile providers.

topics/geo.name: gmap.py
topics/geo.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/geo/gmap.py example shows a grid of map plot centered at Austin, TX using Bokeh's Google maps integration.

topics/graph.name: from_networkx.py
topics/graph.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/graph/from_networkx.py example shows a network graph plot of the NetworkX desargues_graph dataset with large circles for vertices.

topics/graph.name: node_and_edge_attributes.py
topics/graph.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/graph/node_and_edge_attributes.py example shows a network graph plot of the NetworkX karate club dataset with large circles for vertices.

topics/timeseries.name: candlestick.py
topics/timeseries.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/timeseries/candlestick.py example shows a candlestick chart for stock data.

topics/timeseries.name: missing_dates.py
topics/timeseries.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/timeseries/missing_dates.py example shows a candlestick chart for stock data with gaps for missing dates removed.

topics/pie.name: pie.py
topics/pie.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/pie/pie.py example shows a pie chart of random data with a legend.

topics/pie.name: donut.py
topics/pie.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/pie/donut.py example shows a donut chart of browser share percentages with a legend.

topics/pie.name: burtin.py
topics/pie.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/pie/burtin.py example shows a reproduction of Burtin's historical antibiotics plot.

topics/stats.name: histogram.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/histogram.py example shows a histogram of sampled data from a normal (Gaussian) distribution overlaid with a line showing the ideal distribution curve.

topics/stats.name: pyramid.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/pyramid.py example shows a pyramid plot showing the age distribution of the male and female Titanic passengers.

topics/stats.name: kde2d.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/kde2d.py example shows a bivariate kernel density estimation plot of the autompg data.

topics/stats.name: splom.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/splom.py example shows a SPLOM gridplot of the penguins data set.

topics/stats.name: boxplot.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/boxplot.py example shows a box plot of synthetic data for six categories.

topics/stats.name: sinaplot.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/sinaplot.py example shows a kernel density estimation plot of the lincoln data.

topics/stats.name: density.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/density.py example shows a multiple kernel density estimation of the cows data.

interaction/tools.name: range_tool.py
interaction/tools.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/tools/range_tool.py example shows a column of two plots of timeseries plots of stock price data. The bottom plot shows all the data and has a range tool for controlling the viewport of the top plot.

interaction/linking.name: linked_brushing.py
interaction/linking.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/linking/linked_brushing.py example shows a two different scatter plots of the Palmer penguin dataset with linked selections.

interaction/linking.name: linked_crosshair.py
interaction/linking.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/linking/linked_crosshair.py example shows a two plots with vertical and horizontal crosshair tools linked.

interaction/linking.name: data_table_plot.py
interaction/linking.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/linking/data_table_plot.py example shows a column of a scatter plot and data table that share a data source and have linked selections.

interaction/legends.name: legend_hide.py
interaction/legends.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/legends/legend_hide.py example shows an interactive legend that hides glyphs when legend entries are clicked.

interaction/legends.name: legend_mute.py
interaction/legends.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/legends/legend_mute.py example shows an interactive legend that mutes glyphs when legend entries are clicked.

interaction/js_callbacks.name: slider.py
interaction/js_callbacks.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/js_callbacks/slider.py example shows a layout with a sine plot on the left and sliders on the right to control the sine wave properties such as frequency and phase.

interaction/js_callbacks.name: color_sliders.py
interaction/js_callbacks.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/js_callbacks/color_sliders.py example shows a layout with RGB sliders on the left to control a plot on the right. A colorbar with hover tool is underneath.

interaction/js_callbacks.name: customjs_lasso_mean.py
interaction/js_callbacks.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/js_callbacks/customjs_lasso_mean.py example shows a scatter plot with a lasso selection tool that responds to selections by drawing an indicator line at the average y-position of the selected points.

interaction/js_callbacks.name: js_on_event.py
interaction/js_callbacks.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/js_callbacks/customjs_for_selection_lasso_mean.py example shows a scatter plot with several tools that prints information about js events as they occur, in text box to the right.

interaction/widgets.name: multiselect.py
interaction/widgets.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/widgets/multiselect.py example shows a simple example of a multi-select widget.

interaction/widgets.name: multichoice.py
interaction/widgets.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/widgets/multichoice.py example shows a simple example of a multi-choice widget.

interaction/widgets.name: date_picker.py
interaction/widgets.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/widgets/date_picker.py example shows a simple example of a widget for selecting dates and date ranges.

interaction/widgets.name: dropdown.py
interaction/widgets.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/widgets/dropdown.py example shows a simple example of a dropdown button widget.

interaction/widgets.name: data_table.py
interaction/widgets.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/widgets/data_table.py example shows a simple example of a data table widget with multiple columns.

interaction/widgets.name: data_cube.py
interaction/widgets.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/widgets/data_cube.py example shows a simple example of a data cube widget for hierarchical data.

server/app.name: movies
server/app.alt: Thumbnail featuring an interactive query tool for a set of IMDB data. Tool features a default graph of the Tomato Meter (x-axis) against the number of reviews (y-axis). Graph can be refined using multiple variables including cast names, director name, number of Oscar wins, year released, end year released, genre, dollar at the box office, and more.
server/app.desc: An interactive query tool for a set of IMDB data.(source code)

server/app.name: selection_histogram
server/app.alt: Thumbnail featuring axis histograms for selected and non-selected points in a scatter plot. Axes unlabeled.
server/app.desc: Shows axis histograms for selected and non-selected points in a scatter plot. (source code)

server/app.name: weather
server/app.alt: Thumbnail featuring interactive weather statistics for three cities. Features drop down for city and distribution. X-axis features date, the y-axis features temperature.
server/app.desc: Interactive weather statistics for three cities. (source code)

server/app.name: sliders
server/app.alt: Thumbnail of plotted trigonometric function with sliders for offset, amplitude, phase, and frequency.
server/app.desc: A basic demo that has sliders for controlling a plotted trigonometric function. (source code)

server/app.name: crossfilter
server/app.alt: Thumbnail of example scatter plot with drop downs for x-axis, y-axis, color, and size. Default graph features mpg on the x-axis, hp on the y-axis, and shows a downward exponential trend.
server/app.desc: Explore the autompg data set by selecting and highlighting different dimensions. (source code)

server/app.name: gapminder
server/app.alt: Thumbnail of a page featuring a reproduction of the Gapminder demo and containing an embedded TED talk video added using a custom page template. Gapminder demo shows children per woman (x-axis), life expectancy at birth in years (y-axis), by nation, over the years (slider), and a play button that allows data to play across slider range of 1964 - 2012.
server/app.desc: A reproduction of the famous Gapminder demo, with embedded video added using a custom page template. (source code)

server/app.name: stocks
server/app.alt: Thumbnail image of linked plots, summary statistics, and correlations for market data. Contains two drop down selections for different investment options. Left features a scatterplot of option one's returns vs option two's returns. Below features a line plot of each individual option. Right shows basic statistics of each option and each option's returns.
server/app.desc: Linked plots, summary statistics, and correlations for market data. (source code)

server/app.name: surface3d
server/app.alt: Thumbnail for surface3d example. Axes are rotated slightly and shown with perspective. A 3D surface is plotted, and colored with a heat map corresponding to z axis value.
server/app.desc: An updating 3d plot that demonstrates using Bokeh custom extensions to wrap third-party JavaScript libraries. (source code)

server/app.name: export_csv
server/app.alt: Thumbnail for export_csv example. Image shows an interface for filtering data with a slider widget, and writing the results by clicking a button.
server/app.desc: Link sliders filter a data table that can be saved as a CSV. (source code)
